column5: Hi OFC, Looking for your insight and wisdom here.  4 of us have booked an ice bungalow for mid Jan weekend with Primetime Fishing Huts.  We are all new to fishing the area but not new to ice fishing. Not sure if we are going to be in 20-40-100 ft.  Any tips or experiences there would help us for sure.  Thank you in advance
We meet up in Minett if that narrows it down a bit
Use minnows.  the fish are small and don't often go for spoons and such.
Thanks for the tip. We'll have minnows.  I saw a you tube video of guys jigging spoons and catching small lakers so have to try it if that fails.  Anyone else been there on ice?
Some of us use a slip float for their light bite. The smaller ones tend to nibble a bit before swallowing.
Those little 2lbr's on Joe smash emeralds like they've never eaten before, lol.   I'm always the one running for  the tipup!!  lol
Thanks again guys.  Great tips!  I'll let you know how we do.  If there are any other tips i'd like to know. Cheers

We had some success Friday-Sunday catching 14 Lakers averaging 1-3 lbs (well 15 if you count the little guy I lost at the hole).  Medium minnows with a small jig or treble off the bottom worked better than anything else.  No ling pike or eyes.  Was a fun weekend.  Thanks for the tips guys.
